Question: Consider the following data in (coordinate, sign) format: ((-4, 4),positive), ((4, -4),positive), ((-1, -1),-1) , ((1, 1),-1). Clearly, the points are not linearly separable, so we will try three alternative approaches to solving the problem. Approach 1: Nested linear classifiers Let $w=\left[\begin{array}{l}+1 \\ -1\end{array}\right]$ and $a=\left[\begin{array}{l}a_{1} \\ a_{2}\end{array}\right]$ where $$ \begin{aligned} a_{1} &=\operatorname{sign}\left(w^{T} x+4\right) \\ a_{2} &=\operatorname{sign}\left(w^{T} x-4\right) \\ y_{\text {predicted }} &=\operatorname{sign}\left(v_{1} a_{1}+v_{2} a_{2}+v_{0}\right) \end{aligned} $$ (a) Select the value of v2 so that the nested classifier correctly predicts the value in the data set.
